required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of a Deep Learning System for Multiple Ocular Fundus Diseases Using Retinal Images
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of a Deep Learning System for Multiple Ocular Fundus Diseases Using Retinal Images: a Multi-center Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Retinal images can reflect both fundus and systemic conditions (diabetes and cardiovascular disease) and firstly to be used for medical artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm training due to its advantages of clinical significance and easy to obtain. Here, the investigators developed a single network model that can mine the characteristics among multiple fundus diseases, which was trained by plenty of fundus images with one or several disease labels (if they have) in each of them. The model performance was compared with those of both native and international ophthalmologists. The model was further tested by datasets with different camera types and validated by three external datasets prospectively collected from the clinical sites where the model would be applied.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the receiver operating characteristic curve of the deep learning system
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will calculate the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve of deep learning system and compare this index between deep learning system and human doctors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of the deep learning system
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will calculate the sensitivity of deep learning system and compare this index between deep learning system and human doctors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of the deep learning system
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will calculate the specificity of deep learning system and compare this index between deep learning system and human doctors.

arm_group.description: Retinal images collected from hospitals and multiple screening sites all over China
Retinal images separated from training dataset
Retinal images prospectively collected from the hospitals and ocular disease screening sites totally different from training dataset

intervention.description: Training dataset was used to train the deep learning model, which was validated and tested by other two datasets.

study_pop.textblock: Retinal images were collected from different health care institutes all over China and other countries around the world.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The quality of fundus images should clinical acceptable. More than 80% of the fundus image area including four main regions (optic disk, macular, upper and lower retinal vessel archs) are easy to read and discriminate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Images with light leakage (>30% of area), spots from lens flares or stains, and overexposure were excluded from further analysis.

facility.name: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen Univerisity
